ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Cantera 1.7.0 installation win XP 32 bit Visual Studio 2005
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, the 2005 version of Visual Studio cannot be used to build the Python module, since the distributed version of Python was built with the older Visual

Yes, the 2005 version of Visual Studio cannot be used to build the  
Python module, since the distributed version of Python was built with  
the older Visual Studio 2003 (or .NET).  One possibility is to get  
the Python source code and compile it yourself, but I haven't tried  
this on Windows, so I don't know how compatible the Python source is  
with Visual Studio 2005.  The same problem occurs with respect to the  
MATLAB toolbox, but of course there is no option to compile MATLAB  
from source.  The only solution is to use Visual Studio 2003.


On Mar 15, 2007, at 3:32 PM, pughpatrick wrote:

> I have tried following Dr. Goodwin's instructions for the windows
> installation.  At the end of the build solution, I get 2 errors.
> These errors are related to Python 2.5   The error message indicates a
> problem with Visual Studio 2005 (professional ed) not being able to
> read some python files.  It says the Python files were created with
> Visual Studio 2003 and it (2005 version) can not read them.  The error
> message indicates that use of cygwin  -c mingw32 for recompiling the
> (python) setup.py file might help.
>
> I am a bit stumped by this. Is this typical for a normal windows
> installation.
>
